original_title: Dengue cases in 2023 three times higher than last two years
original_body_lines: The dengue cases reported so far in 2023 are three times higher than the cases recorded in the corresponding period of the last two years, stated Deputy Director of Medical Services Dr. G. Wijesuriya.
Speaking to Daily Mirror, he said the country would see a major increase in cases in the coming weeks as well as the rainy condition was expected to intensify further.
“We have already noticed a rapid increase in cases among which the majority of cases are from the Colombo and Gampaha districts,” he noted.
“Hence, we advise people to take measures like destroying habitats available for mosquitoes, using mosquito repellents, not letting water stagnate and wearing protective clothing,” he highlighted.

When asked whether there are congestion in hospitals due to dengue patients, Dr Wijesuriya said although there was no congestions in normal wards, minor congestion could be observed at ICUs in several hospitals.
Meanwhile, Dr Wijesuriya who is also the Director at the Lady Ridgeway Hospital (LRH) said a total of 45 children are currently undergoing treatment for dengue at the LRH.
“Majority of children are between the ages 05 to 14. Besides, there are also children being treated for severe dengue known as dengue hemorrhagic fever,” he added. (Sheain Fernandopulle)
